title: Drawing, "Nature Studies including a Candelabra Tree with a Sloth, Rio Magdalena, Colombia", May 1853
medium: Graphite, brush and oxidized white gouache on gray paper
markings:
Recto:  Stamped in ink, at lower left:  Lugt 457c
Verso:  Stamped in ink, at center:  Lugt 457d
inscribed: Inscribed in graphite, at upper center: small tree / Candelabra tree / sloth feeds on it.  / Light green; again, at center: These trees often / cover an Island and / the light foliage of which / presents a charming con- / trast to the darker foliage; again, at center: May / Many trees appear to be just budding and / are of a brownish color (stems / also)  These contrast finely with the heavier foliage; again, at bottom left:  Bank sandy / festoons of pinkish / flowers; and again, at bottom right: little Isle bushes, wild plantain, grass.
description: Horizontal view containing a group of trees at upper left; a candelabra tree with a sloth, at upper center; a branch and a tree top, at upper right; a group of trees, at lower left; a tree, at lower center; plants, at lower right.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Nature Studies including a Candelabra Tree with a Sloth, Rio Magdalena, Colombia", May 1853.
May 1853. Graphite, brush and oxidized white gouache on gray paper. Gift of Louis P. Church. 1917-4-140.
